reviews.review_msg: Peter is hands down one of the best profs I have ever had. His lectures are amazing; he is engaging and hilarious, and he is so knowledgeable about the course contents. The course materials were interesting and diverse, and the workload was reasonable and incredibly interesting. I loved this class so much!

Paul Budra is the best professor I have ever had the pleasure of learning from. His lectures are incredibly engaging and I believe he could make any subject interesting. He explains things very in depth, is hilarious and incredibly kind and approachable. He gave me and my friends free tickets to see his play! I adore him and highly recommend!

Dr. Budra is FIRE. You will need a lot of books because the course does require readings but they are decent and not too long. Dr. Budra explains the material well and is entertaining. The only thing that makes it difficult is the lack of assignments, but the final helps as a booster since it is open book. Overall, amazing class and professor.

honestly came into english thinking it was going to be tough, but Paul made it very easy to understand. final exam was easy as long as you understand the themes and core topics, and the final was open text. This is a reading and writing intensive course. so beware

Prof Budra is really passionate about theatre and it's definitely reflected in his lectures. Make sure to read the books or at least read sparknotes before lecture, it will make lectures have a lot more sense. Try to remember what he says about the meanings of the plays, it will help in final :)

Looking for a writing cred that won't bore you to death? Look no further! Prof. Budra's classes were short, sweet, informative and HILARIOUS. I cannot stress how funny and super sweet this guy is. he's super passionate abt his work and his theatrical background is apparent in his teaching. he doesn't post lec slide tho, so make a friend!

Professor Budra is a carrying professor that is very passionate about his work. His love for theatre is what makes the class enjoyable. He genuinely wants you to succeed, and always makes sure his lectures are comprehensible and fun to attend. If his your professor, you're in good hands!!

One of the best teachers, professors, and role models at SFU. He is such a kind and caring individual who will take the time to talk to you about English. He is passionate and FUNNY; if you need a good laugh go take his class. Though there is lots of reading to do, he makes it easy to understand!
Professor Budra makes lectures engaging, blending his theater background to keep the class fun and easy to follow. Bring your books for the final, and use unstuck AI to prep - it's a lifesaver!

He's funny during lecture and even if you're not into the content, he keeps you entertained. My issue is that there's no rubric. Like I have no idea how they were grading us, not to mention they mark hard with vague and unhelpful comments. Tutorials are also useless. Final is decent though, have a decent understanding of stuff and you'll be fine.

Dr. Budra gave absolutely amazing lectures, his background in theater is obviously. Has the ability to cover alot of information in a short amount of time while keeping it easy to follow and fun. Would highly recommend his class. 10/10 would take again.

Expects you to remain focused and off your phones for the entirety of the class. Funny, though, and accommodating. Welcomes questions and is understanding. My T.A. was a slightly hard marker, but I liked this class overall. Might come off as strict or stern, but is fun and explains the readings thoroughly. Good prof.

Dr Budra is so knowledgeable and the perfect fit for an Old English Lit prof. He gives awesome background info on difficult stories from old ages which actually makes them more interesting. There are no midterms, just 2 essays and one final where you can bring your books. Just have a good knowledge on the book material and youll have fun! Love him
